result.execSummary:
The defendant Delvin Kentrell Wilder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court is not opposed to defendant crossing state lines.

records.addlTxt: -For Release; Received, filed and signed by the Court on June 10, 2016; Copies distributed to parties.

Defendant Delvin Kentrell Wilder in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Delvin Kentrell Wilder in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case in court to address condition time on the defendant. Additional statement by: Probation agent Lauren Carlton. For reasons stated on the record, Motion for condition time DENIED by the Court. Court ordered defendant released FORTHWITH from custody.
-Attorney Ann Bowe returned call to set hearing to address condition time on June 10, 2016 at 8:30 a.m, Branch 31.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Rifelj
for review. os

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[ x  ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant sentenced to serve 180 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 (zero) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months: If revoked: Huber release privileges for work ONLY:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

     *   Obtain and maintain employment or
          actively looking.
     *   No firearms; dangerous weapons.
     *   No possession of illegal drugs.
     *   Successfully complete (25) hours of community
          service.
     *   Court is not opposed to defendant crossing state lines. 
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges during the 
          period of probation.  
          Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due 
          immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
          
          
  
    
 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit; received and filed.

Defendant Delvin Kentrell Wilder in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Delvin Kentrell Wilder in court with attorney Olya Petukhova on behalf of attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Delvin Kentrell Wilder in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. Defense requested a plea and sentencing date.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
-From Assistant District Attorney Alex Mueller; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

-State's Motion In Limine from Assistant District Attorney Alex Mueller; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
-From Assistant District Attorney Alex Mueller; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Delvin Kentrell Wilder in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Case is adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 37.  Jury trial scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
No use or possession of any controlled substances or drug paraphenilia without a valid prescription  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-07-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Delvin Kentrell Wilder in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 04-23-2015
